verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of king<WH4428> Lemuel<WH3927>, the prophecy<WH4853> that his mother<WH517> taught<WH3256> him.
What, my son<WH1248>? and what, the son<WH1248> of my womb<WH990>? and what, the son<WH1248> of my vows<WH5088>?
Give<WH5414> not thy strength<WH2428> unto women<WH802>, nor thy ways<WH1870> to that which destroyeth<WH4229> kings<WH4428>.
It is not for kings<WH4428>, O Lemuel<WH3927>, it is not for kings<WH4428> to drink<WH8354> wine<WH3196>; nor for<WH335> <WH176> princes<WH7336> strong drink<WH7941>:

Lest they drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> the law<WH2710>, and pervert<WH8138> the judgment<WH1779> of any of the afflicted<WH1121> <WH6040>. prevert: Heb. alter of any: Heb. of all the sons of affliction
Give<WH5414> strong drink<WH7941> unto him that is ready to perish<WH6>, and wine<WH3196> unto those that be of heavy<WH4751> hearts<WH5315>. of: Heb. bitter of soul
Let him drink<WH8354>, and forget<WH7911> his poverty<WH7389>, and remember<WH2142> his misery<WH5999> no more.
Open<WH6605> thy mouth<WH6310> for the dumb<WH483> in the cause<WH1779> of all such as are appointed<WH1121> to destruction<WH2475>. such: Heb. the sons of destruction
Open<WH6605> thy mouth<WH6310>, judge<WH8199> righteously<WH6664>, and plead<WH1777> the cause of the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>.
Who can find<WH4672> a virtuous<WH2428> woman<WH802>? for her price<WH4377> is far<WH7350> above rubies<WH6443>.
The heart<WH3820> of her husband<WH1167> doth safely trust<WH982> in her, so that he shall have no need<WH2637> of spoil<WH7998>.
She will do<WH1580> him good<WH2896> and not evil<WH7451> all the days<WH3117> of her life<WH2416>.
She seeketh<WH1875> wool<WH6785>, and flax<WH6593>, and worketh<WH6213> willingly<WH2656> with her hands<WH3709>.
She is like the merchants'<WH5503> ships<WH591>; she bringeth<WH935> her food<WH3899> from afar<WH4801>.
She riseth<WH6965> also while it is yet night<WH3915>, and giveth<WH5414> meat<WH2964> to her household<WH1004>, and a portion<WH2706> to her maidens<WH5291>.
She considereth<WH2161> a field<WH7704>, and buyeth<WH3947> it: with the fruit<WH6529> of her hands<WH3709> she planteth<WH5193> a vineyard<WH3754>. buyeth: Heb. taketh
She girdeth<WH2296> her loins<WH4975> with strength<WH5797>, and strengtheneth<WH553> her arms<WH2220>.
She perceiveth<WH2938> that her merchandise<WH5504> is good<WH2896>: her candle<WH5216> goeth not out<WH3518> by night<WH3915>. She: Heb. She tasteth
She layeth<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the spindle<WH3601>, and her hands<WH3709> hold<WH8551> the distaff<WH6418>.
She stretcheth out<WH6566> her hand<WH3709> to the poor<WH6041>; yea, she reacheth forth<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the needy<WH34>. She: Heb. She spreadeth
She is not afraid<WH3372> of the snow<WH7950> for her household<WH1004>: for all her household<WH1004> are clothed<WH3847> with scarlet<WH8144>. scarlet: or, double garments
She maketh<WH6213> herself coverings of tapestry<WH4765>; her clothing<WH3830> is silk<WH8336> and purple<WH713>.
Her husband<WH1167> is known<WH3045> in the gates<WH8179>, when he sitteth<WH3427> among the elders<WH2205> of the land<WH776>.
She maketh<WH6213> fine linen<WH5466>, and selleth<WH4376> it; and delivereth<WH5414> girdles<WH2289> unto the merchant<WH3669>.
Strength<WH5797> and honour<WH1926> are her clothing<WH3830>; and she shall rejoice<WH7832> in time<WH3117> to come<WH314>.
She openeth<WH6605> her mouth<WH6310> with wisdom<WH2451>; and in her tongue<WH3956> is the law<WH8451> of kindness<WH2617>.
She looketh well<WH6822> to the ways<WH1979> <WH1979> of her household<WH1004>, and eateth<WH398> not the bread<WH3899> of idleness<WH6104>.
Her children<WH1121> arise up<WH6965>, and call her blessed<WH833>; her husband<WH1167> also, and he praiseth<WH1984> her.
Many<WH7227> daughters<WH1323> have done<WH6213> virtuously<WH2428>, but thou excellest<WH5927> them all. have: or, have gotten riches
Favour<WH2580> is deceitful<WH8267>, and beauty<WH3308> is vain<WH1892>: but a woman<WH802> that feareth<WH3373> the LORD<WH3068>, she shall be praised<WH1984>.
Give<WH5414> her of the fruit<WH6529> of her hands<WH3027>; and let her own works<WH4639> praise<WH1984> her in the gates<WH8179>.
